instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage, quarter fan spin
threads.message:
Hello,

I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with water damage around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and <CHIP>U3890</CHIP> areas. Cleaned up and now getting a single quarter fan spin, no loop.

I started checking for shorts, but am not exactly sure what is meant by that: if I am to measure short to ground on <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> do I also have to measure all the sub-circuits in that list, like <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_LPCPLUS</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_SMC</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H_BATT</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H_CHGR</SIGNAL>, PP3V42_G3H_ONEWIREPROT etc.? If not, I checked all the main rails and there is no short.

Any ideas?

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage, quarter fan spin
threads.message: Oh, and I do get a green light on the charger!

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage, quarter fan spin
threads.message: Could be anything. First check all traces to <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and try a known good chip/dump, save the old. CPU Vcore coming high during the fan pulse?

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage, quarter fan spin
threads.message: CPU Vcore is coming high for a moment. <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> was replaced with one from donor board. Same issue. About checking rails for shorts: do I also need to test all the sub-rails or just the main ones?

threads.title: macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage, quarter fan spin
threads.message: Check everything, but as CPU Vcore is coming high that means all power should be ok. Chips from donor boards are many times not good as they are erased.
